metadata.title: CVE-2019-13568 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
CImg through 2.6.7 has a heap-based buffer overflow in _load_bmp in CImg.hbecause of erroneous memory allocation for a malformed BMP image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cimg-examples - 2.8.4+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cimg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.4+dfsg-1').
